topics.body:
. . . . UGGGGGGGHHHHHHH. . . .

I'm getting more and more annoyed lately and nobody seems to want to fuck off and leave me alone.

To make it succinct basically my family won't feck off and leave me alone for two seconds.  I'll admit I'm in the wrong here cause I don't want to spend time with people, but it's not cause I'm being anti-social but rather I don't feel anything from family bonding.  Basically despite how I act to be emotional and such I rarely and never to nearly as much as other people feel emotions.  I pretend to be emotional because that's how I interact with people, but to use an analogy think of human emotions as like a filled cup; hyper-emotion people are like a overfilled cup, emotionally cold people are like a cup that's half empty; I'm more along the lines of a cup that only the bare bottom part has anything in it.  If I weren't constantly forced to act "HAPPY HAPPY HAPPY(tm)" I would act drastically different.


The reason why I'm annoyed is that I can't act honestly cause the first assumption everyone makes is that something must be wrong.
"What's wrong?"
"Nothing"
"Something must be wrong if you don't want to hang out; what's wrong?"
"Nothing"
"You're not acting happy; what's wrong?"
"Nothing"
"What's wrong?"
"Nothing"

Not being happy doesn't automatically mean being depressed.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54b9b92663687258d4900600#post_54b9b92663687258d4900600
[bq="SquiggyBomb"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54b9b8546368725233040b00#post_54b9b8546368725233040b00
I don't mean to sound like a jerk.
But they're your family man.[/bq]
I know I'm in the wrong but think about it from a cold emotionally void viewpoint; if you were constantly forced to pretend to be emotional and the second that you don't act "happy happy happy(tm)" everyone bombards you with thinking you're sad wouldn't that annoy you too?

Not to sound like a jackass but people with lots of emotions are annoying cause they simply don't get the idea of not being happy doesn't mean depressed and thus you have to pretend to be emotional.



Side note: anyone here that has unironically uses "u mad bro" against me in a argument or such is incredibly stupid.
